Second adventure question
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher EVO Archive (PS2): Miscellaneous Q & A: Second adventure question
By madmod2001 on Saturday, April 22, 2006 - 05:01 pm:

Just wondering if this is a glitch or if I am doing something wrong. I've gotten to the point where my monster has to push a botton to continue, but no monster is able to move that button. I've tried little monsters to big monsters(golems and dragons). They try to push the button but it never moved. I'm hoping it's not a glitch as I don't think I would start the game over again.

By Kit_Wanderer on Saturday, April 22, 2006 - 05:13 pm:

Are you talking about the one on top of the spiraling path? Just press your monster against the wall (button), a scene of it pushing the button will show up eventually (takes probably 3-5 seconds until the scene shows up).

By madmod2001 on Saturday, April 22, 2006 - 08:11 pm:

Looks like I found a glitch then. It just will not let me push that button. Glad to know I not doing anything wrong. Just to make sure I tried pushing the button for a good minute or two. Nothing happened. I thought maybe it did something that I didn't notice, but nope. Thanks for trying to help though.

By Tjmax on Saturday, April 22, 2006 - 08:57 pm:

just keep pressing the monsters against it but dont hit the X button (that was what was keeping me from doing it for a while).

By Apocalypse on Saturday, April 22, 2006 - 09:02 pm:

First push Triangle. The monster status screen will turn the monster to green. Then move your monster near the switch and push the control stick towards it. I think any monster can do it, though I know for a fact that Tiger and Golem can.

By Blulightning on Saturday, April 22, 2006 - 10:27 pm:

I noticed something about the things that trigger events in adventures...

your person has to step a ways away from the object being manipulated then you have to use your monster, with the triangle button, from a distance.

Try staying in the same place where the first cutscene about the button occured, and then sending your monster towards the button.
I'd almost guarantee it'd work, but I don't know whether or not only certain monsters can trigger it.

By Deadbuffalo on Saturday, May 20, 2006 - 12:18 pm:

So far my pirro, suezo, and maya have been unable to push this button. I have a gitan as well, but I doubt he'll be any better at pushing the button. Looks like you might need something slightly meatier to push the button. If anyone has had success with any of the above monsters lemme know.

By kilak on Saturday, May 20, 2006 - 12:39 pm:

I have had no issues using any monster to trigger any of the switchs in the factory

By Deadbuffalo on Saturday, May 20, 2006 - 01:27 pm:

Yeah, I just figured it out. I forgot to turn the other crank first. You can't push the button until the green goo is drained. Its because I didn't get to the button on my first time through, but didn't hit the crank on my second trip.

By Lightining on Tuesday, June 6, 2006 - 05:09 pm:

The secret to this one madmod is you must trigger this switch with your person not the monster. You are to try to make a path to cross to the other side.

By Sturnum94 on Friday, July 21, 2006 - 01:06 pm:

Would the big lever at the beginning have something to do with this, because I'm also stuck.
